citation.article-title: Characterization of filamentous Eikelboom type 021N bacteria and description of Thiothrix disciformis sp. nov. and Thiothrix flexilis sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Thiothrix flexilis sp. nov.
Thiothrix flexilis (fle.xi'lis. L. adj. flexilis pliable)
Cells are rod and form slightly bent multicellular filaments.
Filaments are more than 0.5 mm long and can reach several millimetres.
Colonies are fingerprintlike.
Cell morphology in filaments is variable, particularly for length, and discoid to ovoid-shaped cells are often observed.
Cells are 1.0-4.0 μm in diameter and 0.5-5.5 μm in length.
Elongate and swollen cells are sometimes present in filaments.
Septa are clearly visible between individual cells.
Gram-negative.
A sheath is absent.
Rosettes and holdfasts are observed in some but not all strains.
Gliding gonidia are produced from the end of the filaments only in rosetteforming strains.
Volutin inclusions are not usually observed.
Sudanophilic granules are observed within cells.
Growth occurs in the temperature range 14-37°C and pH range 7.0-7.9, but there is no growth at 4 or 42°C.
Optimum temperature 20-30°C.
Oxidaseand catalase-positive.
When cells are grown in the presence of a reduced inorganic sulfur compound, only a few sulfur granules are deposited and there is no production or only slight production of sulfuric acid.
Sulfur globules are normally not present in trichomes in situ.
Reduced inorganic sulfur is not required for growth.

Glucose, fructose, mannose, sucrose, maltose, trehalose, mannitol, lactate, propionate, succinate, pyruvate, acetate, malate, hydroxybutyrate, glutamate and aspartate are utilized as sole carbon sources.
Almost all strains utilize citrate and alanine.
No growth occurs with glycerol, butyrate, benzoate, xylose, erythritol, galactose, lactose, melibiose, raffinose, arabinose, rhamnose, ethanol, 1-propanol, sorbitol, formate, gelatin or starch.
Good growth occurs in 0.1% NaCl and growth is inhibited slightly in 2% (w/v) NaCl.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
The G+C content of the DNA is 44 mol% (HPLC).
The major quinone is UQ-8.
The major fatty acids are C16:1, C16:0 and C18:1.
Isolated from activated sludge suffering from bulking.
The type strain is strain EJ2M-BT (=DSM 14609T=JCM 11135T).
Additional strains are EJ1M-B (=JCM 11134) and SNR-3 (=JCM 11130).
